website_summaries.verdict: Connects via Bluetooth to your smart devices and pairs up nicely so you can jam with more than 100 MIDI applications and feel like a rock star.
pros: Anyone can learn — from beginners to pros who need to practice
Strings are awesome and feels like a true guitar
cons: Could be hard to hold for some because the backside is made of slippery plastic

customer_reviews.title: it is a great device to practice beginning scales and chords on the ...
customer_reviews.text: While this shouldn't be used in place of a regular guitar, it is a great device to practice beginning scales and chords on the fly when you don't have the room or desire to get out the real thing. I have found that the very best use for it is in GarageBand where you can replicate an endless amount of sounds to make your own background tracks. I could not for the life of me get the darned strap on though. The holes on the strap itself are way too small to force the peg into it to attach to the Jamstik. But I'm content playing it seated in a chair anyway on my lap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great practice tool.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my wife so she could practice anywhere without having to bring her actual guitar. She loves it and uses it all the time. Has helped significantly with her finger strength.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Fewel

customer_reviews.title: Great. I bought it for my 18 year old ...
customer_reviews.text: Great. I bought it for my 18 year old daughter who has an iPhone 6. She had it working in about 5 minutes. You have to download the app to your phone, then just plug and play. The app lets you change the sound (guitar, ukulele, etc.) Came with picks and a strap. The strings and frets feel pretty real. However, your picking hand will be a lot closer to your left hand than for a real guitar. If you break a string I think you have to order a replacement from the company.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Not used for learning, just needed midi guitar tool
customer_reviews.text: Its great and all, but i just cant figure out how to tune the darn thing. .. lol in all seriousness for the price and technology it is solid. My first one was broken and the replacement has been just fine. I am not using this as a learning tool just a heads up, but as a midi device. Its great for composing, and getting something outside the box in terms of sound. It would be nice to have at least 12 frets but who knows mayb e one day. Its more accurate then expensive guitar to midi software, in case anyone reading this is wondering.
customer_reviews.author: D Black

customer_reviews.title: NOT A GUITAR REPLACEMENT!
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all. If you are looking for a portable guitar to play, looks elsewhere. This is just an overpriced kid's toy with annoying lag. You simply can't play it as a regular guitar and believe my I've been playing guitar for the last 25 years.
customer_reviews.author: Max G.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great instrument and I have found the apps that they ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great instrument and I have found the apps that they have some of the best teaching tools. I have to admit I have never been a great student but have always wanted to learn. This instrument makes it fun and easy for an older learner. I bet younger students would find it even more valuable. I like the way it is small and fits in a backpack. You can basically have it with you at any time you may have a few minutes to practice. It really is fun and others like seeing it. Thanks, Russell Taylor
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Its letting me learn at my pace
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how it would be if you knew how to play but it is very helpful in learning by yourself with sound and app feedback of how you are doing and its compact size.
customer_reviews.author: jleasure

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing outcomes with this product!
customer_reviews.text: The delivery method was "throw the box over the fence" which was the delivery services BAD. The Jamstik+ package (not the shipping package) looked as though it had been used before. the tape generally used to seal the opening was not secure and the box looked as though it had been "sealed" multiple times. The inner packaging and information card were also damaged. So far the device has been plugged in 3 hours and light is not green. Device is supposed to be BlueTooth but my iPad doesn't recognize it. The app download states to login through WiFi but Jamstik+ doesn't show there either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was totally surprised.
customer_reviews.text: After charging the battery and installing the apps. I was totally surprised at how well the Jamstik+ sounded very impressed. I use to make musical instruments as ahobby. I bought the Jamstik+ for one of my Great Grand kids.who plays the Piano, Violin, and wants to learn play the Flute and other instruments, and he is only 8 years old. This was well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to hold and play at the same time. The shoulders strap is necessary but unusable because the pins don't lock in. They constantly fall out. I messed with for about an hour and got frustrated and put it back in the box and returned it. The lag is difficult to ignore even after the firmware update. If you don't have an Apple product you lose a ton of functionality. It's a toy at best. I was pretty disappointed with it.
customer_reviews.author: waggs

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful addition to any musician's arsenal of instruments
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an early Father's day gift for the Hubby and he simply LOVED IT !! There are many online resources to use with the JamStik and tutorials to teach you all the tricks you need to learn to maximize your enjoyment of this amazingly cool musical instrument !
customer_reviews.author: NanaTia

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners, but not for intermediate/advanced players.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional musician by any means, but I have been playing guitar for quite a while. The idea of having a portable midi that plays like a guitar and connects directly to GarageBand is what I found appealing about this product. However, I can't recommend it for that type of usage. Due to the inconsistency with the sensitivity, finger picking of any sort is incredibly difficult and sounds terrible. I can see it being a decent device for kids in learning how to play certain chords, but that's really about it.
customer_reviews.author: Jared L

customer_reviews.title: Jamstik+
customer_reviews.text: I liked it but it wasn't want I was looking for, it was alright but it was not for my use at this time, maybe some other time I may repurchase it again, I do not have an iPhone or iPad but that is not why I am sending it back, I am sending it back because I have no use for it at this time
customer_reviews.author: Allan Trzcinski

customer_reviews.title: I returned mine
customer_reviews.text: Just felt like a very low quality product. String feel is awful, it doesn't use pickups to detect what you're playing, just simple pressure sensors on the neck. Mine went straight back in the box and got returned.
customer_reviews.author: Fjölnir Ásgeirsson

customer_reviews.title: Junk product that doesn't work with PC
customer_reviews.text: I should have known that this would be the case since the manufacturer touts their compatibility with Garage Band - a limited DAW that hasn't been relevant for years. The instructions and website talk about how easy this junk is to pair with iOS products and treats PC and Android like an afterthought. Turns out that's because it is. It won't connect to my PC (i9-9900K system w/ 16 GB of RAM that can run ANYTHING that I've ever thrown at it) regardless of if I use USB, bluetooth or both. The Android support is laughable at best. Avoid this at all cost unless you want an overpriced, USB powered door stop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: first jamstick was defective second one held up for 6 months
customer_reviews.author: RONALD A LANCASTER

customer_reviews.title: nice idea, but
customer_reviews.text: On balance, I don't like it... needs one more fret... also, its only good for chords... can't keep up with scales and picking. The 'bridge cover' is also flimsy, and the little plastic switches that the strings actuate are made of flimsy plastic too. the plastic switch for my high 'e' string broke on its maiden voyage, and I had to improvise with a paper-clip. Do they sell replacement flimsy plastic switches?
customer_reviews.author: Ian Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great Learning Tool
customer_reviews.text: This perfect for beginners and great for playing around. Love that it is quiet and I can practice at any time of the night and not disturb the neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: Resolution

customer_reviews.title: great, this is what I was waiting
customer_reviews.text: I've been played an acoustic guitar more than 10 years, but I don't like to tune string. So I was looking for the guitar with no tuning required. This is it. Latency was my concern. But no problem when connecitng with Android. Maybe iPhone is dame. No latency on Android (and iPhone). But if played with Windows computer, it has latency and hard to play stroking. So I don't recommend to play on Windows computer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable product for fun
customer_reviews.text: This product can not comparable with a real guitar at the same price. But It's really fun to play with it. Alot of thing that you can do with this guitar through app on phone. you will not have the feel like play real guitar. But it good for practice
customer_reviews.author: Duong

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy, love it. It made guitar fun.
customer_reviews.text: This thing came BROKEN! Yes, totally busted. But the concept, and the little bit I did get to play with it deserves 4 stars. If I enjoyed a busted one, I imagine I'll enjoy a functional one even more.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Was not at all what was expected.
customer_reviews.text: Was a disaster. Just did not provide a positive starting place for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Cary

customer_reviews.title: This is a great practice guitar
customer_reviews.text: This is a great practice guitar. The only problem I have is with the 5 frets. I realize you can click on the capo button to reach higher frets, but it's difficult to do it within a song that would require several capo changes. The great thing is the size and the ability to take it on an airplane and a practice using earbuds connected the a smart phone. You're not disturbing your seat neighbors and not only are you making good use of the time, the flight goes faster. I highly recommend the JamstikPlus.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Ledger

customer_reviews.title: good battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I really do like this Jamstik. it doesn't necessarily get the sound on the chords right but is a great replacement for my real guitar when I'm traveling around. the battery life is great I can go several days without charging it.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon Snyder

customer_reviews.title: nice, easy to use and learn basic guitar techniques
customer_reviews.text: nice, easy to use and learn basic guitar techniques. I would like to see the neck a bit longer with a few more frets to better expand guitar skills while learning
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: We just took this out of the box . My husband hadn’t had time to try it out because of our vacation . He’s very disappointed in the product . It does not work as specified and when we went to return it we were 1 day past the return date .
customer_reviews.author: Walker33

customer_reviews.title: better at guitar then when I started
customer_reviews.text: 12/27..48 hrs later, better at guitar then when I started. Report back later
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Great for teaching guitar
customer_reviews.text: A great little product. Bought initially as a present for a family member, but ended up opening it and using it with my son. Now ordering more for presents. As an experienced guitarist I expected it to feel cheap and tacky like a toy,but I was really impressed with the build quality and feel. Very responsive - no noticable lag, I had expected latency issues but it's very responsive. A great little product for teaching.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for me
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the negative reviewers were expecting, but this thing is awesome. I'm just learning and realizing how hard playing guitar really is! This makes it easy to practice. The apps are simple and the instruction on Jam Tutor is nifty. My kids are starting to learn also but the neck is a bit too wide for their hands. Highly recommend for newbies like myself. I know plenty of guitarists but I haven't showed it off yet so I'm not sure what their thoughts are.
customer_reviews.author: Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Better explanation ( Why, how, etc). You need to explain why you used that way
customer_reviews.text: I’ll try to learn how to play, it is complícate. Doesn’t explain very well
customer_reviews.author: Jeannett Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: It's good but not fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I think it's a great product for the price, and it works really well. The only downside it has is the guitar itself is heavier than you expect and it won't work with any android devices, since you can't install the proper app to play the Jamstik with. Do I recommend it? Yes and no, yes because it's really portable and would be a great addition for a guitar player. No because it only works with IOS devices not android, and it is not as lightweight as some other guitars. But if you play guitar and have a iPhone, I would totally recommend this to you.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte C.

customer_reviews.title: The appearance was good as I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jamstik+ last december. The appearance was good as I expected. But problem was the latency. Latency was longer than my expectation. After enjoying jamstik+ for 2-3 days, I put it in the box and I forget it. Yesterday, Waiting for my families, I took out the jamstik from the box again and ran jamstik app, I discovered a message showed up 'new firmware available'. So I followed the instruction. After it, now I'm happy with the low latency. I'm not sure when the new firmware released but the firmware really saved my jamstik+. Now I can recommend this jamstik+ for every guitar beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Jiman K.

customer_reviews.title: It’s not too bad
customer_reviews.text: I found the strings way too tight but a seasoned guitarist would find it acceptable
customer_reviews.author: ChuckC

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I am 24 and have always wanted to learn to play guitar, so after winning my fantasy football league this year and taking home some nice prize money, I decided to buy the Jamstik+. I've had it about a week now and I am so happy I made the decision to get it. Already I have learned a few basic chords and can start to play some easier songs. The progress I have been able to make in such a short amount of time has me excited to keep going. I have had no latency issues using the jamstik with my ipad.
customer_reviews.author: N.S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool for learning guitar.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a semi experienced player. Have about nine guitars. Love to play and slef taught. Always had trouble with scales. This little dude solved it. Already learned E and D scales and making my own solos. The lessons and are great. The sensors show u where to put ur fingers and if ur on the right spot. Very good tool for beginner. If you want to learn, I would highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio & Brandi Moreira

customer_reviews.title: Not a Midi controller
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely a waste of time and money if you need to use it as a Midi controller
customer_reviews.author: Damilola

customer_reviews.title: but that's the only legitimate complaint from the bad reviews that I can tell
customer_reviews.text: There's latency if you're source (iPhone/iPad) is hooked into another sound source via bluetooth, but that's the only legitimate complaint from the bad reviews that I can tell. This thing is everything it's advertised to be.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: great sound, from my 1pad 4 with128 gb
customer_reviews.text: great sound, from my 1pad 4 with128 gb, with with good spearkers.setup was quick and easy and works great with garage band. Haven't use it with my ipad Mini 4 and iphone 6s both have 128 gb of storage and don,t see any problems setting them up. I gave it 4 stars because i wish it was at lease 12 inch longer give more to hold , but with that said, it works great so far, maybe someone will make a type of cardle to set it into to make it longer ????? Now all is we need is the porting the software to windows now, so i can use it on my desktop with a 7.1 speaker system
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Calabro

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Arrived when they said it would. Walks you through the basics of guitar playing.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Bouldin

customer_reviews.title: Hey - this thing is a blast!  And I'm getting better!
customer_reviews.text: In a new and different phase of my life and I decided that I wanted to learn to play the guitar. Lessons were both expensive and hard to set up for convenient times. Also, that's not always the best way for me to learn. So when I saw the Jamstik, I thought it was my best shot at attaining my goal. So far, so great! The lessons are fun, the device was easy to set up and I'm able to go back to develop the basics that I know will help me to play guitar. I'm getting better every time that I practice. This is a well thought out product that is perfect for what I want.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Tuna

customer_reviews.title: I loved the idea but had to return it because it ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea but had to return it because it is too small for an adult to hold. It was not as responsive as I would have liked. I had to reset the bluetooth connection frequently to sync it. I did learn a lot in the few days I played with it. Great learning tool but it needs to be perfected.
customer_reviews.author: gabguz

customer_reviews.title: It may even cultivate you some bad habits that will be harmful when you perform on ...
customer_reviews.text: You may consider it as another type of new musical instrument but never think it can be your guitar alternative or replacement. If you want to learn guitar, go buy a real one. This "smart guitar" can benefit nothing for guitar practicing especially to the beginners. It may even cultivate you some bad habits that will be harmful when you perform on a real guitar.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Got it to connect.
customer_reviews.text: Decided to keep it and play with it. But deduct one star because they need to not confuse customer on instruction to connect. Key is selecting the right app to connect. There was no latency when I played. There was an extra humming noise but I closed the app and reopened it. Glad it works now I will hopefully enjoy it!
customer_reviews.author: D. Choi

customer_reviews.title: I LIKE IT !!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome device. I have tried to learn to play guitar since I was a teenager (long time ago). I could never keep up the motivation. This time I think I'm going to get it. I've just started, but I'm really impressed with this thing and I'm really committed
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't get it to connect
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to connect this ting to my iPad for about an hour. No luck. I've followed the instructions on the manufacturer's website, I have Bluetooth enabled, I'm using the jamstik+ app...nothing. I see the jamstik on my android phone's bluetooth when I turn that on, but it will not connect to the iPad. I'm still waiting to hear from customer support. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: E. M. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is so cool!!!! I'm 44 years old and always wanted to learn how to play. This is easy and fun!
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: Big delay, not really a instrument by expensive gadget.
customer_reviews.text: For quite some time I'm trying to find travelling guitar compact that you don't need to plan to take it on your trips, but you just putt it in your bag and go. I watched a couple of review on Youtube, and I figure out that Jamstik+ is it! When I finally got it, big disappointment. I took some time to test given options with several latest Android devices (with a firmware update and suggested device settings), Ipad (latest and older iOS) and finally with my DAW using cable and all had the same big delay. All the time. @ Zivix, I hope you will fix this since it's a great idea.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Muzicka

customer_reviews.title: Good innovative product
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for learning Guitar. Yes granted this is not the real thing, and there will be a learning curve when switching to the real thing. But there is a market for self paced instrument learning, and this definitely helped to get started. Also cool for MIDI playing of virtual instrument, much more convincing results than playing using a Midi keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: S. Chatterjee

customer_reviews.title: fantastic learning tool
customer_reviews.text: I want to learn to play guitar but I'm very busy most of the time so this is an ideal tool. The build is top quality with real strings and a sturdy body. I use a note 4 and a Nvidia sheild to play and learn.The charge lasts pretty long though I don't play it ad often. My only gripe is you can't connect it to a speaker or headphones directly to play as it a doesn't have one built in ,always has to be connected to the device.Wish there was more app support and a way to download songs into it to learn to play them
customer_reviews.author: Prophit

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased this is a wonderful itemfor beginners intermediate and professional guitar players
customer_reviews.author: patty sorrentino

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome I'll be taking it to India with me much ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome I'll be taking it to India with me much easier to take than full size guitar
customer_reviews.author: Atul J.

customer_reviews.title: Was super excited to try the Jamstik+ out as it got ...
customer_reviews.text: Was super excited to try the Jamstik+ out as it got great reviews. When I received it there were a series of frustrating missteps in configuring the software, with various bugs and obscure settings that I had to go back and forth with tech support about. Luckily they were very helpful in getting everything sorted out. So far really enjoying it. Hopefully they'll work the kinks out of the setup process with time.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas A Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: Super fun !
customer_reviews.text: This is super fun to play ! the customer service is 100% AWESOME !! They will answer your questions and if there are any issues they tend to them fast and correct any problems. Don't hesitate to buy a jamstik - I love mine !
customer_reviews.author: K. Kier

customer_reviews.title: its not very easy play or practice with this devise
customer_reviews.text: its not very easy play or practice with this devise. the neck is too small, and the way it hangs from your shoulder, its very hard to hold. I was going to returns it, but the kids wants to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: E.Aghassi

customer_reviews.title: Not a beginners guitar, limited use, difficult to hold and play
customer_reviews.text: This is not a beginners guitar. Tutorials on the iPad app are too limited and videos are not integrated with the finger sensors. Buy a real guitar instead and get Rock Prodigy and/or Jamplay. The guitar is difficult to hold due to the small size and bad strap design. Sound is ok but nothing like what you can get from a real guitar. It would be attractive as a midi guitar if string bending worked better. So I don't see any advantage over other midi controllers like You Rock Guitar or a keyboard
customer_reviews.author: lm

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't have bought it if I had tried it first
customer_reviews.text: It's not at all how I thought it would perform. One of the strings appear much louder than the others. I thought the strings would act as guitar strings do on a real guitar and gradually fade as their vibration subsided but it's actually set as a timed event (about 7 seconds). Hammer ons are not very sensitive. No piano sound included with software. You have to buy it from the play store separately. I use the Linux operating system and I haven't found any software yet that will work with the Jamstick+. I wish I could have tried it first before buying it because I wouldn't have bought it. It's more like a kids toy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool
customer_reviews.text: Love it for travel. Helps me stay up with my learning program and picking and Gi Geri g skills development.
customer_reviews.author: jeff kinsey

customer_reviews.title: Sounds are horrible and lame
customer_reviews.text: Remember your cheap Casio keyboard from the 80's? Yeah, same thing. Sounds are horrible and lame. Good idea, just needs improvement. How can this not have a crunchy/ heavy guitar sound as an option? Maybe I'm using it wrong. DLed apps, still garbage sounds as options. Can't believe such a cool piece of technology is so stripped down with lame out dated tones.
customer_reviews.author: Hey Underpants

customer_reviews.title: Not quite ready for prime time
customer_reviews.text: Portable but doesn't really feel like a guitar nor can I get decent volume out of my new iMac or iPad. Perhaps the next generation will replace my Traveller.
customer_reviews.author: On The Run

customer_reviews.title: Hard to describe.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to describe. Latency was hit and miss. I've played guitar for many years and really wanted this controller to work. Habits learned on the guitar do not translate well to this device. Might be a good learning tool. I don't know that. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Two most annoying things...
customer_reviews.text: Painful setup, top 3 strings didn't work for a while. Very confusing. Bought for my 11 and 10 year old to practice guitar, not for kids learning. Two most annoying things are you need headphones to plug into iPhone or iPad to hear what you are playing and the latency is way too long from time to strum note to time you hear. I'm not a musician, maybe they are better equipped, but my brain does not function that way. FYI from Wikipedia: "Latency refers to a short period of delay (usually measured in milliseconds) between when an audio signal enters and when it emerges from a system."
customer_reviews.author: Neil McConnell

customer_reviews.title: Android use not clear when purchased
customer_reviews.text: Waiting for Jamstick staff to update for the android app. App only for my phone at this point and it is difficult to see. Hoping they get around to the android for the Samsung Galaxy tablets soon.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Regan

customer_reviews.title: Problem
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why this side doesn't make any sound!!! I try to do everything!! Could you help me guys !!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My mom didn't like it because it requires a monthly subscription
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift and am unable to get a refund. My mom didn't like it because it requires a monthly subscription. Fix the subscription and refund policy and I would give it better reviews. It is a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Luis F Raudry III

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made cheap plastic crap for which I paid $400
customer_reviews.text: This item broke 2 wweeks after purchase. Poorly made cheap plastic crap for which I paid $400.00
customer_reviews.author: Ben Antel

customer_reviews.title: This things "okay"
customer_reviews.text: This things pretty cool and a great technical advancement but still has a way to go. Biggest problem for me is you can't do slides or hammers or Palm mutes really. Latency is a bit annoying as well. I would recommend this product. It's just not as great as I had hoped
customer_reviews.author: Brian McKie

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: not sensitive to finger inputs, must be the settings, which i cannot find in the net. lacks support
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There are some lags between strokings and actual sound comings which keep annoying me.
customer_reviews.text: It is little smaller than expected. I pair this with my iPad air 2. There are some lags between strokings and actual sound comings which keep annoying me.
customer_reviews.author: Miyoung Han

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this to do midi guitar recordings but some guitar features are lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Alton Bertie

customer_reviews.title: It was kinda fun.
customer_reviews.text: It's cool but if your heart isn't in it this won't do it.
customer_reviews.author: Loumore

customer_reviews.title: Package arrived with missing items (no picks, strap or ...
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived with missing items (no picks, strap or micro USB charging cable). Nowhere on the product description was it indicated that these items were missing. Should have been disclosed prior to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Louis P. Lozada

customer_reviews.title: I gave this a shot but didn't really like it. It's a great concept but I found ...
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a shot but didn't really like it. It's a great concept but I found it difficult to switch from one cord to another while trying to strum the instrument. The software is good and I think someone could learn a lot from it but I would get more from a full size guitar with the same concept.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Averett

customer_reviews.title: (1) Annoying latency even with wired speaker
customer_reviews.text: (1) Annoying latency even with wired speaker; (2) A "mute" switch placed in a very inappropriate place (can be triggered unintentionally); (3) It looks more like a toy than a musical instrument.
customer_reviews.author: MASASHI MUNECHIKA

customer_reviews.title: Latency
customer_reviews.text: Terrible latency and lots of trouble getting it to connect to bluetooth. Oh I wanted this to work sooooo bad the concept is something I need to take on the road but just not there.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Tomassetti

customer_reviews.title: BAD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a gift. It is broken and not returnable.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Savala

customer_reviews.title: Huge waste of money now the product is useless
customer_reviews.text: Cheap string retainers are plastic. Now one of the strings doesn't play properly. Huge waste of money now the product is useless.

product_meta.title: Zivix, 6-String Jamstik Smart Guitar, Right Handed (J-BLE-BK-R-CS)
product_meta.description:
Style:Case Bundle

The jamstik+ is a digital guitar that works wirelessly (Bluetooth) with your devices and our apps to finally teach you how to play guitar. It comes with an interactive guitar lesson app series and works with a multitude of other music apps, so everyone from beginners to pros can just play. The jamstik+ comes with: 4 free apps, a guitar strap, 2 guitar picks and a rechargeable battery. 



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 




YES YOU CAN LEARN TO PLAY GUITAR. Maybe you tried guitar lessons once upon a time, learned a few chords but didn’t stick with it for various reasons like: cost or time. Or maybe you’ve never tried to learn for the same reasons. Those roadblocks are exactly why we created the jamstik+, the app-enabled smart guitar that teaches you how to play. Fast.

IN FACT, YOU'LL BE PLAYING CHORDS IN MINUTES. How? The jamstik+ interactive teaching apps walk you through step by step. Sensors in the jamstik+ detect the placement of your fingers and display them in the app, giving you instant feedback with zero guesswork. Don’t know how to read music or hold a pick? No problem. No music experience is needed to be successful with the jamstik+. It doesn’t even need tuning.




GUITAR & LESSONS IN ONE When you buy a jamstik+ your lessons are included in the form of simple, interactive teaching apps; saving you money.

WIRELESS & PORTABLE The Bluetooth connection to your device is fast, stable and best of all, wireless. Being untethered gives you freedom to practice and play anytime, anywhere.

MIDI: PLAY ANY SOUND Already a guitar player? The jamstik+ is a versatile MIDI controller, compatible with 100s of apps, so you can create virtually any sound you can think of. 









About the Startup Describe your product in 3 words.

Learn. Play. Create.

How did you come up with the idea for this product?

The inspiration for the jamstik+ was ignited when we saw the popularity of guitar rhythm games peak in the late 2000’s. The desire to learn guitar was amplified. At the same time, we saw the rise of mobile devices and the ways in which they were changing how we live, work and play. Bringing these worlds together resulted in the jamstik+, a portable smart guitar that can truly teach anyone how to play.

What makes your product special?

The jamstik+ is the only digital (MIDI) guitar that has real strings, real frets and optcal sensors, which provide instant feedback while you're learning.

What has been the best part of your startup experience?

Without a doubt, the best part is seeing the looks on people's faces when they play their very first guitar chords on the jamstik+. They're surprised, excited and want to keep playing.
feature_bullets: Portable MIDI guitar controller: compatible with any DAW (digital audio workstation), music apps, and music notation software

Wireless and convenient: at just over 16 inches long, The Jamstik+ is the most portable option of the Jamstik product line. Take it with you in your backpack or travel case, easily connect over Bluetooth or USB, and practice and create wherever you go

Sensors in the jamstik's Fretboard provide real-time feedback so you can see your fingers on the screen of your device. Compatible with all of the Jamstik guitar learning software for iOS and the Google Chrome Web browser on Mac or PC

Made with real strings and Frets. Play quietly with headphones, or make some noise with an amp or speaker connected to your device. Always use a wired connection when listening with headphones or speakers
Bundled version includes custom padded travel case
